title: 'Record' Drone Barrage Pummels Ukraine As Missile Tensions Seethe
content: Russia launched a record 188 drones at Ukraine overnight, Kyiv said Tuesday, amid growing international tensions after Russia fired a nuclear-capable missile that could reach European cities.
summary: Russia launched a record 188 drones at Ukraine overnight, Kyiv said Tuesday, amid growing international tensions after Russia fired a nuclear-capable missile that could reach European cities.

title: Opinion: Two Sides Of The Same Coin: Fundamentalists Share Worldview Yet Remain Hostile
content: Earlier this month, tragic news from Texas brought the abortion debate into sharp focus.
summary: Earlier this month, tragic news from Texas brought the abortion debate into sharp focus.

title: Social Media, Artificial Intelligence Fuelling "Worst Human Impulses": United Nations Head
content: Uncontrolled social media networks and artificial intelligence amplify the worst human impulses, allowing hate speech to spread like wildfire and ignite violence, UN secretary general Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday.
summary: Uncontrolled social media networks and artificial intelligence amplify the worst human impulses, allowing hate speech to spread like wildfire and ignite violence, UN secretary general Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday.

title: "Remarkable Global Progress": HIV Cases, Deaths Declining
content: The number of new HIV infections and deaths is falling worldwide, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease.
summary: The number of new HIV infections and deaths is falling worldwide, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease.

title: Meet Ajahn Siripanyo, The Monk Who Gave Up His Father's $5 Billion Empire
content: The only son of Malaysian billionaire Ananda Krishnan, Ven Ajahn Siripanyo gave up the world of riches and spoils to become a Buddhist monk.
summary: The only son of Malaysian billionaire Ananda Krishnan, Ven Ajahn Siripanyo gave up the world of riches and spoils to become a Buddhist monk.

title: World's Oldest Man Dies At 112: Guinness World Records
content: The world's oldest man, Briton John Tinniswood, has died aged 112 at the care home where he lived in Southport, northwest England, Guinness World Records said on Tuesday, quoting his family.
summary: The world's oldest man, Briton John Tinniswood, has died aged 112 at the care home where he lived in Southport, northwest England, Guinness World Records said on Tuesday, quoting his family.

title: Warren Buffett Donates $1.2 Billion, Reflects Upon How "Fickle" Life Can Be
content: Warren Buffett, philanthropist and multi-billionaire CEO of American multinational conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway, has donated another $1.2 billion of his wealth to foundations, serving his 2006 pledge to steadily donate his $150 billion wealth.
summary: Warren Buffett, philanthropist and multi-billionaire CEO of American multinational conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway, has donated another $1.2 billion of his wealth to foundations, serving his 2006 pledge to steadily donate his $150 billion wealth.

title: China Deploys Forces As US Aircraft Flies Over Taiwan Strait
content: Beijing said Tuesday it deployed air and naval forces to monitor a US military plane as it flew over politically sensitive waters separating China and Taiwan.
summary: Beijing said Tuesday it deployed air and naval forces to monitor a US military plane as it flew over politically sensitive waters separating China and Taiwan.

title: Walmart To Scale Back Diversity Initiatives Amid Conservative Pressure
content: A Walmart spokesperson confirmed the changes, stating, "We are willing to change alongside our associates and customers who represent all of America."
summary: A Walmart spokesperson confirmed the changes, stating, "We are willing to change alongside our associates and customers who represent all of America."

title: Study Finds Severe Covid Response Could Help Shrink Tumors
content: A groundbreaking study suggests severe COVID infections may generate special immune cells capable of shrinking advanced cancers in mice, opening doors to innovative cancer treatments.
summary: A groundbreaking study suggests severe COVID infections may generate special immune cells capable of shrinking advanced cancers in mice, opening doors to innovative cancer treatments.

title: Pakistan Army Gives "Shoot-At-Sight" Order Against Imran Khan Protesters
content: As the situation worsened in Pakistan's capital Islamabad amid fierce protests demanding the release of former prime minister Imran Khan, the government asked the army to intervene.
summary: As the situation worsened in Pakistan's capital Islamabad amid fierce protests demanding the release of former prime minister Imran Khan, the government asked the army to intervene.

title: Vietnam Tycoon On Death Row Begs Court For Life
content: A Vietnamese property tycoon sentenced to death for multi-billion-dollar fraud begged a court to spare her life Tuesday, saying she was trying to repay the stolen funds.
summary: A Vietnamese property tycoon sentenced to death for multi-billion-dollar fraud begged a court to spare her life Tuesday, saying she was trying to repay the stolen funds.

title: Hong Kong LGBTQ Activist Wins Posthumous Legal Victory
content: Nearly four years after his death, LGBTQ activist Edgar Ng was vindicated by Hong Kong's top court Tuesday as judges ruled in his favour on housing and inheritance rights for same-sex couples.
summary: Nearly four years after his death, LGBTQ activist Edgar Ng was vindicated by Hong Kong's top court Tuesday as judges ruled in his favour on housing and inheritance rights for same-sex couples.

title: Supporters Of Arrested Hindu Priest Thrashed Outside Bangladesh Court
content: Clashes erupted between police and supporters of arrested Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das outside a court in Bangladesh's Chattogran on Tuesday.
summary: Clashes erupted between police and supporters of arrested Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das outside a court in Bangladesh's Chattogran on Tuesday.

title: Not Going To Get Solution From Battlefield: EAM S Jaishankar On Ukraine War
content: Mr. Jaishankar emphasised India's reliance on Italy's support in its engagement with the European Union, highlighting the EU as India's largest trade partner and key investor.
summary: Mr. Jaishankar emphasised India's reliance on Italy's support in its engagement with the European Union, highlighting the EU as India's largest trade partner and key investor.

title: After Donald Trump Vows Big Tariffs, A Warning From China Over Trade War
content: China warned on Tuesday that "no one will win a trade war" after US President-elect Donald Trump vowed to impose sweeping tariffs on goods from China and elsewhere in response to illegal drug trade and immigration.
summary: China warned on Tuesday that "no one will win a trade war" after US President-elect Donald Trump vowed to impose sweeping tariffs on goods from China and elsewhere in response to illegal drug trade and immigration.

title: Scientists Uncover Possible Flaw In Einstein's Theory Of Space-Time
content: A new study by scientists from the Universities of Geneva and Toulouse has found a small inconsistency in Einstein's general relativity predictions.
summary: A new study by scientists from the Universities of Geneva and Toulouse has found a small inconsistency in Einstein's general relativity predictions.

title: Midweek Flights, Long Layovers: Flight Attendants' Tips To Fly Stress-Free
content: With the holiday season fast approaching, two flight attendants have shared their expert tips to help you survive the travel chaos.

title: Man Who Once Guarded Russia's Nuclear Base Reveals Its War Secrets
content: A former officer in Russia's nuclear forces is among the rare few to speak out about his experiences at one of the country's most secretive military bases.
summary: A former officer in Russia's nuclear forces is among the rare few to speak out about his experiences at one of the country's most secretive military bases.

title: All About Emily Calandrelli And Her Historic Space Journey
content: Emily Calandrelli, an MIT-trained engineer and future Blue Origin astronaut, recently made history after she became the 100th woman to venture into space.
summary: Emily Calandrelli, an MIT-trained engineer and future Blue Origin astronaut, recently made history after she became the 100th woman to venture into space.
